Description: Remains of one pendant one bead and one spacer-bead. A: Poppy seed pendant, made in carnelian, broken at the perforation, well smoothed. B: One barrel-shaped bead made of white faience. C: Fragments of probably originally one spacer-bead made of light blue faience. One segment intact, another broken. Quite short in height.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Amara West (Nubia), D14.8A, cupboard in town wall
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
